item.title: 5 Reasons Traveling Makes You a Better Person
item.dc:creator: StayBazar
item.description: Traveling connects you to the world in mysterious ways. It reminds you of the ground beneath your feet and the sky above your head. When it comes to the big picture, nothing comes closer than packing your bags and heading out to see it for yourself. Here’s a run down on the top five reasons […]
item.content:encoded:
Traveling connects you to the world in mysterious ways. It reminds you of the ground beneath your feet and the sky above your head. When it comes to the big picture, nothing comes closer than packing your bags and heading out to see it for yourself. Here’s a run down on the top five reasons we love to travel –

  1. You get out of your comfort zone

Living in the city means you have to get used to a routine. From the minute you wake up, you know what needs to be done for the rest of the day. You’ve already decided your outfit for the day, rehearsed your meetings and presentations, have a special spot at your local bar and order the same thing every time. It’s just the way it is. Traveling breaks old habits and gives you space to breathe while inviting change.

  1. You make new friends

Having a friend circle is great when you’re in the hood but when you’ve arrived at your destination, you end up meeting and greeting new faces. It could be the cute girl at the counter, the homestay owner or someone you bump into, they’re all just a hello away from becoming your new friends.

  1. You gain experiences

Some of the wealthiest people in the world invest their money on experiences because at the end of the day, you’re more than just the stuff you own. Being on the move reminds you of that and makes you explore the world with childlike eyes of wonder and excitement.

  1. You learn more about the world

The world is like a book and those who don’t travel read only a page. The world is bigger than the serviced apartment you rent and many interesting people are waiting to meet you and make you a part of their story. Every place has its own unique culture and traveling gives you an insight into the unknown. Remember, there are no strange places, just new ones.

  1. You learn more about yourself

It is on journeys taken far and wide that you discover your hidden potential. Anything can happen while you’re traveling and each moment reveals a unique part of you, like pieces of a puzzle. Maybe you’ll find that you don’t like cream in your coffee or find out how soothing a walk on the beach can be. These little incidents can become the most cherished treasures you’ll uncover and traveling is the way to do it.

If you’re finally convinced, then get off your behind and get on the road!

item.content:encoded:
Rich with natural resources and beautiful landscapes, India is a diverse land that offers a wealth of experiences for travelers from around the world. If its your first time traveling in India and you are itching to plan your next trip, we’ve got just the thing for you. Be sure to hit these towns on your way to get a taste of the true flavour this great nation.

Bangalore

Known as the Silicon Valley of India, Bangalore has gained a reputation for being a metropolitan in the true sense. The city is bustling with theatre plays, counter-culture performances, WiFi enabled zones and the most number of pubs you’ll ever find. People book serviced apartments in this tech town to have their share of artistic ambitions while living the big city life.

Mumbai

Mumbai is the city that never sleeps. From A-list Bollywood bashes to street side vada pavs, you can get whatever you want and whenever you want it. The food tastes heavenly and costs well under your budget but the real estate is quite expensive. That’s the only downside to this live wire of a city but it is also the place where Indian dreams come true.

Goa

Goa is the party capital of India. It is surrounded by plenty of beaches, each with its own unique vibe. Take a banana boat ride at the beach, eat delicious sea food, sing at the karaoke bar or just unwind at little shacks spread across the shore. It also has beautiful churches with a culture that celebrates life in any way it can.

Jaipur

Popularly called the Pink City, Jaipur is an architectural jewel like no other. It is one-third of the Golden Triangle of Indian tourism. Hotel and resorts can cut a hole in your pocket so finding alternative stay options is your best bet. Visitors can find plenty of attractions such as Hawa Mahal, Jal Mahal, City Palace, Amer Fort, Jantar Mantar, Nahargarh Fort, Galtaji and Govind Dev Ji Temple among others.

Agra

Situated on the banks of river Yamuna, Agra is home to one of the Wonders of the World, The Taj Mahal. Agra, Jaipur and Delhi form the Golden Triangle of Indian tourism. The city has a rich culture of arts dating back to the Mughal era and masterpieces can be found anywhere in the vicinity. Other attractions include the Agra Fort, Fatehpur Sikri, Akbar’s Tomb and the Keetham lake.

 

Come back for more travel destinations when you’ve crossed these five off your list. Until then, keep traveling!

item.title: 5 Things to Carry While Traveling
item.dc:creator: StayBazar
item.description: When the world is filled with wonder and beauty, it’s only natural to want to go out there and see it for yourself. If you are an avid traveler with a sense of adventure, you need to pack light while you are on your journey. Keeping your luggage to a bare minimum is essential to […]
item.content:encoded:
When the world is filled with wonder and beauty, it’s only natural to want to go out there and see it for yourself. If you are an avid traveler with a sense of adventure, you need to pack light while you are on your journey. Keeping your luggage to a bare minimum is essential to make the most of your endeavours. Just tick these things off your checklist and you should be good to go –

  1. Best outfits

When you are out visiting, it’s always good to dress your very best. Meeting new people on trips is an imperative and making an impression can go a long way in making your stay worthwhile. Be it for business or leisure, your favourite outfits are known to bump up your luck at home and can do wonders when you are away.

  1. Cash and cards

If you’re going to an offbeat destination for your holiday, make sure you carry some hard cash with you at all times. Living at an alternative stay away from the hustle and bustle of the city means banks and ATMs may be off the radar for miles at a stretch. Smaller shops that serve tea and sell other condiments don’t accept cards as payment.

  1. Daily dose

It goes without saying that health is a priority, wherever you go. Secure your daily doses of medicine by packing them in ziplock bags. Prescription drugs are hard to come by and missing out on yours when you need them is the last thing you need on a vacation.

  1. Appsolutely necessary

Smart phones have made things convenient for people everywhere. Internet connectivity and GPS can come in handy on tour, especially when you want to book your resort on the go. Check the App Store with your travel destination and you’ll be surprised by what comes up. For instance, search for Goa and you’ll know exactly what we’re talking about.

  1. Toiletry

Last but not least, pack all your toiletries like toothbrush, sunscreen, deodorant and other supplies before you leave. Remember, the products you use aren’t always available on the shelves which makes your belongings all the more valuable.

Traveling can be an enriching experience only when you do it right. The next time you step out, make sure you have these five pre-requisites to have a great trip.

item.dc:creator: StayBazar

item.content:encoded:
Deepak and I have known each other our entire lives. We went to the same school together. We partied together. We pulled each other’s legs and stood up for each other throughout and now just because his dad wants him to do engineering, he is shifting to Bangalore.

Separation Anxiety

You know how on somedays you accidentally sleep on your hand and wake up without feeling it and freak out. That’s how I felt the day after Deepak left. Suddenly, I didn’t have my wing man at the bar, so no more dates. I didn’t have my chaddi dost to just hang out and kill time everyday. As the days went by I got used to his absence but hey, I’m not the kind who forgets his mates so I wanted to pay my old friend a visit.

Silicon Valley of India

I had never been to Bangalore but I planned on doing it soon. You see, next week is Deepak’s birthday and I’m throwing him a little surprise. I’ve got the whole thing chalked out. I booked a serviced apartment in Banashankari so it’s close to his college hostel. The internet can really come in handy when you want to plan things in a new city. I’m bringing the A team with me, our best buds Srikar and Soumya agreed to tag along for the big day.

Home away from home

The whole crew had come down to Bangalore a couple of days ahead of Deepak’s birthday so we could make our alternative stay look like his room from our home town. We wanted him to feel like he had come back home for his special day and I think we pulled it off. It was perfect. All we needed to do now was wait.

A few hours before the clock hit 12, I texted Deepak the address and asked him to come there before midnight. He kept calling me and I kept cutting the call. I texted him again to confirm I wasn’t kidding. It was 11.30pm when he walked in.

“SURPRISE!”

“What the fish! When did you guys get here? Did you move all my stuff here? Oh my god!” he said.

I took a picture on his face when he walked in so we can never forget it. He was ecstatic and so were we. I told him the whole story over a few drinks and he couldn’t believe someone would go through all that trouble for him. And I told him

“I’d do it all over again bud, cheers, happy birthday to my bestie in Bangalore!”

item.title: I am a Traveler
item.dc:creator: StayBazar
item.description: I am a traveler. I travel to find my home away from home. I travel to find my friends who I haven’t met yet. I travel to learn, about myself and the world. It’s not just about moving from one place to another. It’s about blending with people and places you’ve never seen before. Adventure […]
item.content:encoded:
I am a traveler. I travel to find my home away from home. I travel to find my friends who I haven’t met yet. I travel to learn, about myself and the world. It’s not just about moving from one place to another. It’s about blending with people and places you’ve never seen before.

Adventure abound

As a boy looking over the oceans, I dreamt that one day I would venture across the seven seas. So much beauty and so little time. City life can be gruelling and sometimes it makes us forget the things that are truly important. Traveling helps me come out of my comfort zone. When I’m on the road, each step I take leads to a fresh experience. I maybe sharing a room at an alternative stay on the beach or hitch a ride on a rugged motorcycle, I never know what comes next and that’s what keeps me going.

Faces and phases

They say that the world is a book and those who don’t travel read only a page. I couldn’t agree more. From moment to moment, there’s always a chance to meet a new face in a mysterious place. With stay options available at my fingertips, accommodation is the least of my worries. Renting out serviced apartments instantly gives you a place to party and an excuse to invite people over.

Nurture nature

Nature is my sandbox. The mountains bring out the mountaineer in me. The rivers bring out the swimmer in me. The stars bring out the child in me. The great outdoors inspire me to unplug myself and just stand in awe at the marvel of creation. The bounties of nature are bestowed to people unconditionally and I do my best to give back by planting trees and living an eco-friendly life.

Not all those who wander are lost. Every journey I undertake makes me stronger as a person. It makes me who I am.
